alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Henry; Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 11:03PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Henderson, northwestern McDonough, Hancock, southeastern Henry, southern Des Moines, central Lee and southeastern Clark Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1101 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Middletown to Alexandria. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding from heavy rainfall and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Ponding of water on area roadways, and low lying areas will result in impacts to travel. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Middletown, Iowa Army Ammunition Plant and Denmark around 1105 PM CDT. West Burlington around 1120 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Burlington, Carman, Gulf Port, Ferris, Adrian, Carthage, Stronghurst, Gladstone, Biggsville and Burnside. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If the heavy rain continues, a flash flood warning may be needed. Be sure to not drive through flooded roadways. Report any water issues to local law enforecement.
